title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: ggExametrika は、exametrika パッケージの出力をggplot2で可視化するためのパッケージです。 IRT、GRM、潜在クラス・ランク分析、バイクラスタリング、ベイジアンネットワークモデルなど、 幅広い心理測定モデルに対応しています。

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: IRT（2PL, 3PL, 4PL）モデルは、2値応答データから項目パラメータを推定します。

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 能力（theta）の関数として正答確率を表示します。 combinePlots_gg() で複数項目を一度に表示: 能力の範囲をカスタマイズ:
code: # 項目ごとにプロットのリストを返す icc_plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt) icc_plots[[1]]  # 1番目の項目を表示 combinePlots_gg(icc_plots, selectPlots = 1:6) icc_plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt, xvariable = c(-3, 3))

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 各項目がどの能力レベルでどの程度の測定精度を持つかを表示します。 特定の項目を選択:
code: iic_plots <- plotIIC_gg(result_irt) iic_plots[[1]] combinePlots_gg(iic_plots, selectPlots = 1:6) iic_plots <- plotIIC_gg(result_irt, items = c(1, 3, 5))

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 全項目の情報量の合計（テスト情報関数）を表示します。 外観のカスタマイズ:
code: tic_plot <- plotTIC_gg(result_irt) tic_plot plotTIC_gg(result_irt,   title = "カスタムタイトル",   color = "darkred",   linetype = "dashed" )

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 能力の関数として期待総得点を表示します。

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: IRTモデルの低レベル計算関数です。
code: # 4パラメータロジスティックモデル: P(theta) LogisticModel(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0.5, c = 0.2, d = 1.0)  # 指定したthetaでの項目情報量 ItemInformationFunc(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0.5, c = 0.2, d = 1.0)

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: GRMは順序付き多値応答データ（例: リッカート尺度）を扱います。

id: ploticrf_gg-項目カテゴリ応答関数icrf
what: plotICRF_gg: 項目カテゴリ応答関数（ICRF）
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 能力の関数として各応答カテゴリの選択確率を表示します。 特定の項目を選択してカスタマイズ:
code: icrf_plots <- plotICRF_gg(result_grm) icrf_plots[[1]] combinePlots_gg(icrf_plots, selectPlots = 1:5) plotICRF_gg(result_grm,   items = c(1, 2),   title = "項目1-2のICRF",   colors = c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#984EA3", "#FF7F00"),   linetype = "solid",   show_legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "bottom" )

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: GRMデータにも対応しています:

what: plotTIC_gg（GRM版）: テスト情報曲線
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
ggExametrika 入門ガイド
code: # 5カテゴリ項目の theta = 0 での情報量 ItemInformationFunc_GRM(theta = 0, a = 1.5, b = c(-1.5, -0.5, 0.5, 1.5))

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: LCAは2値応答データから潜在クラス（離散的グループ）を識別します。

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド

what: plotCRV_gg: クラス参照ベクトル（CRV）
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 全クラスのプロファイルを1つのプロットにまとめて表示します（クラスごとに異なる線）。 カスタマイズ:
code: crv_plot <- plotCRV_gg(result_bic) crv_plot plotCRV_gg(result_bic,   title = "クラス参照ベクトル",   linetype = "dashed",   legend_position = "bottom" )

what: plotRRV_gg: ランク参照ベクトル（RRV）
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 全ランクのプロファイルを1つのプロットにまとめて表示します（ランクごとに異なる線）。

title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: 2値データ行列をヒートマップとして可視化し、バイクラスタリング後のブロック対角構造を示します。 クラスタリング済みデータのみ表示: クラスタ境界線を非表示:
code: # 元データとクラスタリング済みデータの両方を表示 array_plot <- plotArray_gg(result_bic) array_plot plotArray_gg(result_bic, Original = FALSE, Clusterd = TRUE) plotArray_gg(result_bic, Clusterd_lines = FALSE)

id: bnmベイジアンネットワークモデル
what: 6. BNM（ベイジアンネットワークモデル）
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: BNMはベイジアンネットワークを用いて項目間の依存構造を発見します。

previous_headings: 6. BNM（ベイジアンネットワークモデル）
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: モデルが発見した有向非巡回グラフ（DAG）を可視化します。 レイアウトと外観のカスタマイズ: 利用可能なレイアウト: "sugiyama"（階層型）、"fr"（Fruchterman-Reingold）、 "kk"（Kamada-Kawai）、"tree"、"circle"、"grid"、"stress"
code: dag_plots <- plotGraph_gg(result_bnm) dag_plots[[1]] plotGraph_gg(result_bnm,   layout = "sugiyama",   rankdir = "LR",   node_size = 10,   node_color = "coral",   label_size = 4,   edge_color = "gray60",   title = "BNM DAG" )

what: 11. combinePlots_gg: 複数プロットの配置
title: ggExametrika 入門ガイド
text: combinePlots_gg() は複数のggplotオブジェクトをグリッドレイアウトで配置します。
code: # デフォルト: 最初の6つのプロット plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt) combinePlots_gg(plots)  # 特定のプロットを選択 combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = c(1, 3, 5, 7))  # 全15項目 combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = 1:15)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: ggExametrika provides ggplot2-based visualization functions outputs exametrika package. covers wide range psychometric models including IRT, GRM, Latent Class/Rank Analysis, Biclustering, Bayesian Network Models, .

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: IRT models (2PL, 3PL, 4PL) estimate item parameters binary response data.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows probability correct response function ability (theta). Use combinePlots_gg() display multiple items : can customize ability range:
code: # Returns a list of plots (one per item) icc_plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt) icc_plots[[1]]  # Show first item combinePlots_gg(icc_plots, selectPlots = 1:6) icc_plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt, xvariable = c(-3, 3))

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays precisely item measures ability different theta levels. Select specific items:
code: iic_plots <- plotIIC_gg(result_irt) iic_plots[[1]] combinePlots_gg(iic_plots, selectPlots = 1:6) iic_plots <- plotIIC_gg(result_irt, items = c(1, 3, 5))

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows total test information (sum item information functions). Customize appearance:
code: tic_plot <- plotTIC_gg(result_irt) tic_plot plotTIC_gg(result_irt,   title = "Custom Title",   color = "darkred",   linetype = "dashed" )

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows expected total score function ability.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Low-level computation functions IRT models.
code: # 4-parameter logistic model: P(theta) LogisticModel(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0.5, c = 0.2, d = 1.0)  # Item information at a given theta ItemInformationFunc(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0.5, c = 0.2, d = 1.0)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: GRM handles ordered polytomous response data (e.g., Likert scales).

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays probability response category function ability. Select specific items customize:
code: icrf_plots <- plotICRF_gg(result_grm) icrf_plots[[1]] combinePlots_gg(icrf_plots, selectPlots = 1:5) plotICRF_gg(result_grm,   items = c(1, 2),   title = "ICRF for Items 1-2",   colors = c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#984EA3", "#FF7F00"),   linetype = "solid",   show_legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "bottom" )

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Also works GRM data:

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
code: # Information at theta = 0 for a 5-category item ItemInformationFunc_GRM(theta = 0, a = 1.5, b = c(-1.5, -0.5, 0.5, 1.5))

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: LCA identifies latent classes (discrete groups) binary response data.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows probability correct response item within latent class.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows correct response rate field (item cluster) class.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays number students expected test score per class. Hide student count labels title:
code: trp_plot <- plotTRP_gg(result_lca) trp_plot plotTRP_gg(result_lca, Num_Students = FALSE, title = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays class membership distribution.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows membership probability profile student across classes.
code: # Returns a list of plots (one per student) cmp_plots <- plotCMP_gg(result_lca) cmp_plots[[1]]  # First student combinePlots_gg(cmp_plots, selectPlots = 1:6)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: LRA identifies ordered latent ranks binary response data.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays rank membership distribution.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows membership probability profile student across ranks.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Biclustering simultaneously clusters items (fields) students (ranks).

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays class profiles single plot one line per class. Customize:
code: crv_plot <- plotCRV_gg(result_bic) crv_plot plotCRV_gg(result_bic,   title = "Class Reference Vector",   linetype = "dashed",   legend_position = "bottom" )

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Displays rank profiles single plot one line per rank.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Visualizes binary data matrix heatmap, showing block-diagonal structure biclustering. Show clustered array: Hide cluster boundary lines:
code: # Show both original and clustered arrays array_plot <- plotArray_gg(result_bic) array_plot plotArray_gg(result_bic, Original = FALSE, Clusterd = TRUE) plotArray_gg(result_bic, Clusterd_lines = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: BNM discovers dependency structure among items using Bayesian network.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Visualizes Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) discovered model. Customize layout appearance: Available layouts: "sugiyama" (hierarchical), "fr" (Fruchterman-Reingold), "kk" (Kamada-Kawai), "tree", "circle", "grid", "stress".
code: dag_plots <- plotGraph_gg(result_bnm) dag_plots[[1]] plotGraph_gg(result_bnm,   layout = "sugiyama",   rankdir = "LR",   node_size = 10,   node_color = "coral",   label_size = 4,   edge_color = "gray60",   title = "BNM DAG" )

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: LDLRA adds local dependency structures within rank.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Returns one DAG per rank, showing dependencies change across ranks.
code: dag_plots <- plotGraph_gg(result_ldlra) dag_plots[[1]]  # Rank 1 DAG combinePlots_gg(dag_plots)

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: LDB adds local dependency structures biclustering framework.

what: plotFieldPIRP_gg: Field Parent Item Reference Profile
title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: Shows field performance varies based parent field scores, rank.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: BINET combines Bayesian network structure biclustering framework.

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
code: plotCRV_gg(result_bic,   title = FALSE,   linetype = "dotdash",   show_legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "top" )

title: Getting Started with ggExametrika
text: combinePlots_gg() arranges multiple ggplot objects grid layout.
code: # Default: first 6 plots plots <- plotICC_gg(result_irt) combinePlots_gg(plots)  # Select specific plots combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = c(1, 3, 5, 7))  # All 15 items combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = 1:15)

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: Computes Item Information Function (IIF) four-parameter logistic model Item Response Theory. information function indicates precisely item measures ability different theta levels.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: x Numeric. ability parameter (theta). Numeric. slope (discrimination) parameter. Default 1. b Numeric. location (difficulty) parameter. c Numeric. lower asymptote (guessing) parameter. Default 0. d Numeric. upper asymptote (carelessness) parameter. Default 1.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: numeric value representing item information given ability level.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: Higher discrimination () parameters result higher information. Items provide maximum information near difficulty (b) parameter. guessing (c) upper asymptote (d) parameters reduce maximum information item can provide.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
code: # Information at ability = 0 for an item with b = 0 ItemInformationFunc(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0, c = 0, d = 1) #> [1] 0.5625  # Compare information at different ability levels sapply(seq(-3, 3, 0.5), function(x) ItemInformationFunc(x, a = 1, b = 0)) #>  [1] 0.04517666 0.07010372 0.10499359 0.14914645 0.19661193 0.23500371 #>  [7] 0.25000000 0.23500371 0.19661193 0.14914645 0.10499359 0.07010372 #> [13] 0.04517666

title: GRM Item Information Function — ItemInformationFunc_GRM
text: Computes Item Information Function (IIF) Graded Response Model. information function indicates precisely item measures ability different theta levels.

title: GRM Item Information Function — ItemInformationFunc_GRM
text: theta Numeric. ability parameter (theta). Numeric. slope (discrimination) parameter. b Numeric vector. threshold (boundary) parameters.

title: GRM Item Information Function — ItemInformationFunc_GRM
text: numeric value representing item information given ability level.

title: GRM Item Information Function — ItemInformationFunc_GRM
text: GRM, Item Information Function computed : $$(\theta) = ^2 \sum_{k=1}^{K-1} P_k^*(\theta) [1 - P_k^*(\theta)]$$ \(P_k^*(\theta)\) cumulative probability scoring category \(k\) .

title: GRM Item Information Function — ItemInformationFunc_GRM
code: # Information at ability = 0 for a 5-category item ItemInformationFunc_GRM(theta = 0, a = 1.5, b = c(-1, -0.5, 0.5, 1)) #> [1] 1.651687

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: Computes probability correct response using four-parameter logistic model (4PLM) Item Response Theory.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: x Numeric. ability parameter (theta). Numeric. slope (discrimination) parameter. Default 1. b Numeric. location (difficulty) parameter. c Numeric. lower asymptote (guessing) parameter. Default 0. d Numeric. upper asymptote (carelessness) parameter. Default 1.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: numeric value representing probability correct response.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: four-parameter logistic model extends 3PLM adding upper asymptote parameter d, accounts careless errors high-ability examinees. model formula : $$P(\theta) = c + \frac{d - c}{1 + \exp(-(\theta - b))}$$ Special cases: 1PLM: = 1, c = 0, d = 1 2PLM: c = 0, d = 1 3PLM: d = 1

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
code: # Compute probability for ability = 0, difficulty = 0 LogisticModel(x = 0, a = 1, b = 0, c = 0, d = 1) # Returns 0.5 #> [1] 0.5  # 3PLM with guessing parameter LogisticModel(x = -3, a = 1.5, b = 0, c = 0.2, d = 1) #> [1] 0.2087896

text: data object class "exametrika" model type BNM, LDLRA, LDB, BINET. layout Character string specifying layout algorithm. "TB" (top--bottom, default), "BT" (bottom--top), "LR" (left--right), "RL" (right--left). node_size Numeric value node size. Default 8. node_color Color nodes. TRUE, show edge labels (BINET model). Default TRUE. title Optional character string plot title. NULL, auto-generated.

title: Plot DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph) from exametrika — plotGraph_gg
text: function uses ggraph package create network visualizations. layout algorithm can significantly affect readability graph: "sugiyama": Best DAGs, creates hierarchical layout "tree": Good tree-like structures "fr": Force-directed, good general networks "stress": Minimizes stress, often produces clean layouts

title: Plot DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph) from exametrika — plotGraph_gg

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
text: function supports 2PL, 3PL, 4PL IRT models: 2PL: slope () location (b) parameters 3PL: adds lower asymptote (c) parameter 4PL: adds upper asymptote (d) parameter ICC computed using four-parameter logistic model: $$P(\theta) = c + \frac{d - c}{1 + \exp(-(\theta - b))}$$

title: Plot Item Category Response Function (ICRF) for GRM from exametrika — plotICRF_gg
text: Graded Response Model (GRM) estimates probability selecting ordered response category. item \(K\) categories, ICRF shows \(K\) curves, one category. given ability level, probabilities across categories sum 1. category probabilities derived cumulative probabilities: $$P_k^*(\theta) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp(-(\theta - b_k))}$$ $$P_k(\theta) = P_k^*(\theta) - P_{k+1}^*(\theta)$$

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
text: Item Information Function indicates precisely item measures ability point theta scale. Items higher discrimination parameters provide information. peak information curve occurs near item's difficulty parameter. IRT models (2PL, 3PL, 4PL), function uses standard IRT information function. GRM, information computed : $$(\theta) = ^2 \sum_{k=1}^{K-1} P_k^*(\theta) [1 - P_k^*(\theta)]$$

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) # IRT example result_irt <- IRT(J15S500, model = 3) plots_irt <- plotIIC_gg(result_irt) plots_irt[[1]] # Show IIC for the first item  # GRM example result_grm <- GRM(J5S1000) plots_grm <- plotIIC_gg(result_grm) plots_grm[[1]] # Show IIC for the first item } # }

text: Add plotGraph_gg() DAG visualization using ggraph. Expand help documentation functions. Apply styler::style_pkg() consistent code formatting. Fix compatibility current exametrika package. Add pkgdown site GitHub Actions workflow.

title: ggExametrika 0.0.8
text: Add plotArray_gg() array plot (Biclustering, IRM, LDB, BINET). Add plotFieldPIRP_gg() Field PIRP plot (LDB).

title: ggExametrika 0.0.7
text: Add plotTRP_gg() Test Reference Profile (LCA, LRA, Biclustering, IRM, LDLRA, LDB, BINET). Add plotLCD_gg() Latent Class Distribution (LCA, Biclustering). Add plotLRD_gg() Latent Rank Distribution (LRA, Biclustering, LDLRA, LDB, BINET). Add plotCMP_gg() Class Membership Profile (LCA, Biclustering, BINET). Add plotRMP_gg() Rank Membership Profile (LRA, Biclustering, LDLRA, LDB, BINET, LRAordinal, LRArated).

title: ggExametrika 0.0.6
text: Add plotIRP_gg() Item Reference Profile (LCA, LRA, LDLRA). Add plotFRP_gg() Field Reference Profile (LCA, LRA, Biclustering, IRM, LDB, BINET).

title: ggExametrika 0.0.5
text: Add plotICC_gg() Item Characteristic Curve (IRT: 2PL, 3PL, 4PL). Add plotIIC_gg() Item Information Curve (IRT: 2PL, 3PL, 4PL). Add plotTIC_gg() Test Information Curve (IRT: 2PL, 3PL, 4PL). Add LogisticModel() four-parameter logistic model computation. Add ItemInformationFunc() item information function computation. Add combinePlots_gg() utility arranging multiple plots grid.
